intro: Ceradenia similis, commonly known as the similar ceradenia, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andes region of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many tropical and subtropical plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Ceradenia similis typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as cloud forests. Its leaves are usually elliptical and have a slightly hairy texture.
